revised_title: Binocular Vision and the Pseudoscope: A Study of Stereoscopic Illusions
tldr: This article discusses Charles Wheatstone's research on binocular vision and the pseudoscope, an instrument that creates stereoscopic illusions by inverting the perceived distances of objects. Wheatstone describes the construction and effects of the pseudoscope, as well as various optical illusions it can produce, such as converting the inside of a teacup into a solid convex body and making a bust appear as a deep hollow mask.
